column4: any linux software that supports ipod nano (gen 3) yet?  { rhythmbox/standard ipod libs on ubuntu dont support it }
the latest you mean?
latest nano?  i think.  latest ubuntu?  gutsy here
latest nano? not right now
locked out for now
ahh
have they had good luck hacking previous ones?  reasonable to expect linux hack in a few months or is there some completely new scheme?
the vm fix is best for now--surely there will be a workaround eventually--btw I use my mini with no problems at all--the new nano has special features to lock non-itunes (read linux) out of it
ahh cool
i actually did have luck downloading my songs and playing them on the pc though
from the nano?
correct , thru rhythmbox
then that would be earlier than the newest nano--just dont update the firmware and you should be okay--I use mine with amarok no problem
ahh so it's the FW that matters
if it is blank, then it's not really, but that is the new hash sum reporting it is to prevent us non itunes-ers from doing I dont know what
well actually it was blank when i turned on the ipod (ipod itself saw nothing).  either that or the hash was broken/invlaidated.  something happened though that preventing me from syncing
yeah, google new nano linux and you will see what is up with that
thx

o good idea, it works tho :)
